thread.title: Brandon Jennings asked Knicks for release so he can play for winning team
thread.title_full: Brandon Jennings asked Knicks for release so he can play for winning team

author: Jordan Heck (jordan.heck@performgroup.com)
title: Brandon Jennings asked Knicks for release so he can play for winning team
text:
February 27, 2017 8:48am EST February 27, 2017 8:47am EST Basketball, NBA, News, New York Knicks, English, Brandon Jennings The Knicks waived Brandon Jennings on Monday, but only because that's what he wanted. Brandon Jennings (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:48 a.m. ET 
Updated at 8:48 a.m. ET 
The Knicks plan to waive Brandon Jennings, according to multiple reports. Knicks are waiving Brandon Jennings a day after Charley Rosen called him a "profound disappointment" who "resists the triangle." â€” Stefan Bondy (@SBondyNYDN) February 27, 2017 
The point guard, who was averaging 8.6 points this season, asked to be released by the team, according to ESPN . The reason he asked for a release is because he hopes to play for a playoff-contending team instead of the 24-35 Knicks. 
MORE: JaVale McGee's mom says Shaq 'is bullying men of color' 
According to The Vertical , New York plans to sign Chasson Randle to replace Jennings. Randle was recently waived by the 76ers as a result of the team's trade with Dallas. 
Jennings was once a promising player in Milwaukee, averaging over 19 points during the 2011-12 season. Recently, however, he's been bounced around a few teams, and eventually spent some time in the Development League. 
He still has some flashes of great play, scoring 32 in a December game for New York. He probably won't go anywhere as a starter, but he can be a solid backup guard for a team looking to add depth in a postseason run. Watch This
